page.title: 02COMMUNICATIONS-TELECOM
page.content: THE INTRODUCTION OF COMPUTER TECHNOLOGY HAS BEEN INITIATED BY { {BRITISH TELECOM}AT SALTASH.THE BUILDING HAS BEEN EXPANDED IN 1985 TO ACCEPT THE {SYSTEM X} STORED PROGRAM CONTROL. THE SYSTEM WILL BE FULLY OPERATIONAL BY SEPTEMBER 1988.AT PRESENT THE EXCHANGE HAS 6,400 LINES RISING TO THE MAXIMUM CAPACITY OF 6,800 USING THE{STROWGER ELECTRO- {MECHANICAL SYSTEM,}WITH 500,000 CALLS PASSING THROUGH PER DAY.AFTER COMPUTERISATION THE CAPACITY OF THE EXCHANGE WILL BE MORE SUFFICIENT TO COVER FORSEEABLE NEEDS IN SALTASH. DURING 1986 AND 1987 TRAFFIC CONTROL PATTERNS WILL MONITOR AND FORECAST THE NUMBER OF LINES AND POTENTIAL GROWTH OF THE EXCHANGE WHICH WILL REMAIN PARENTED ON PLYMOUTH.THE FIRST FLOOR OF THE BUILDING WILL HOUSE THE EQUIPMENT FOR SYSTEM X
